name: Scottish Drugs Forum
goal:
Scottish Drugs Forum (SDF) is Scotland’s national resource of expertise on drugs and related issues.

SDF was established in 1986 and is a registered charity and a membership-based organisation.

SDF works to:

• improve the quality, range and effectiveness of service and policy responses to problem drug use in Scotland
• reduce future and recurring problem drug use
• promote and sustain recovery from drug problems

through informing, supporting, leading and representing stakeholders across the drugs and related fields.

SDF contributes to the creation of a healthier, more equal society where:

• everyone can fulfil their personal, social and economic potential
• drugs-related harms cannot thrive
• the needs of those affected by drug use are met effectively and with empathy, compassion and respect.
interests: Budget, Communication, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Research and innovation, Youth
euInitiatives: Scottish Drugs Forum(SDF) is focused on all aspects related to problematic drug use. SDF is a member of the European Civil Society Forum on Drugs.  The main focus is around areas of Health and Justice.
